creator: guest.icm-n-pg-nm-sc-b4@icn.siemens.de
text:
On a German Windows, the task
    <tstamp>
        <format property="TODAY" pattern="yyyy-MMM-dd HH:mm" locale="en_US"/> 
    </tstamp>
generates TODAY as 
"2005-Okt-12 10:21" when it should be 
"2005-Oct-12 10:21".

Seems that the locale is not passed to all relevant Java API calls, and thus 
the German locale of the VM survives.

creator: guest.icm-n-pg-nm-sc-b4@icn.siemens.de
text:
The bug is caused by insufficient documentation of the unusual format of the 
locale string. It works if the task is given as
    <tstamp>
        <format property="TODAY" pattern="yyyy-MMM-dd HH:mm" locale="en,US"/> 
    </tstamp>

Please provide a correct example of specifying a country, the example given in 
the docs:
  <tstamp>
    <format property="TODAY_UK" pattern="d-MMMM-yyyy" locale="en"/>
  </tstamp>

is incomplete and (thus) incorrect. It should read
  <tstamp>
    <format property="TODAY_UK" pattern="d-MMMM-yyyy" locale="en,UK"/>
  </tstamp>

Fixed in HEAD.

Sorry for the trouble and thanks for taking the time to report this.
